original: 'khor mo 'jig gis tshong 'dus dang / srang dang lam gyi bzhi mdo dang / sum mdo dag na 'khyam pa las /
analyzed: 'khor mo 'jig gis tshong 'dus dang / srang dang lam gyi bzhi mdo dang / sum mdo dag na 'khyam pa las /
translated: He wandered around the market, the streets, the crossroads, and the intersections.

original: bkres pas gzir te zas tshol pa'i phyir gla mi dag gnas par song nas 'dug go /
analyzed: bkres pas gzir te zas tshol pa'i phyir gla mi dag gnas par song nas 'dug go /
translated: He went to the places where laborers were gathered, hoping to find work to relieve his hunger.

original: de'i tshe na khyim bdag go'u ta ma'i khyim brtsig ste /
analyzed: de'i tshe na khyim bdag go'u ta ma'i khyim brtsig ste /
translated: At that time, the householder Gautama was building a house.

original: de gla mi rnams tshol ba las /
analyzed: de gla mi rnams tshol ba las /
translated: He was looking for laborers.

original: der mi gzhan zhig gis khyim bdag go'u ta mi'i drung du khrid pa dang / des de mthong nas kye 'di ni rab tu gzhon zhing shin tu gzhon pa zhig ste /
analyzed: der mi gzhan zhig gis khyim bdag go'u ta mi'i drung du khrid pa dang / des de mthong nas kye 'di ni rab tu gzhon zhing shin tu gzhon pa zhig ste /
translated: Another man led him to the householder Gautama, and when he saw him, he said, “Oh, this one is very young and tender.🔽He hasn’t done anyone’s work before. Look for someone else.”

original: sngon su'i las kyang ma byas pa zhig gi gzhan zhig tshol cig ces smras pa dang / de'i mig mchi mas gang bzhin du khyim bdag go'u ta ma'i gdong du lta'o //
analyzed: sngon su'i las kyang ma byas pa zhig gi gzhan zhig tshol cig ces smras pa dang / de'i mig mchi mas gang bzhin du khyim bdag go'u ta ma'i gdong du lta'o //
translated: With his eyes filled with tears, he looked at the householder Gautama’s face.

original: de la khyim bdag go'u ta mas /
analyzed: de la khyim bdag go'u ta mas /
translated: The householder Gautama said to him,

original: bu khyod su yin /
analyzed: bu khyod su yin /
translated: “Son, who are you?”

original: gang nas 'dir 'ongs pa smros shig /
analyzed: gang nas 'dir 'ongs pa smros shig /
translated: Tell me where you have come from.”

original: ces dris pa dang / des snying rje zhing dman la sdug bsngal bas mig mchi mas gang ste /
analyzed: ces dris pa dang / des snying rje zhing dman la sdug bsngal bas mig mchi mas gang ste /
translated: He was pitiful, humble, and miserable. His eyes were filled with tears.

original: tshig kyang brnangs bzhin du ngal nas smras pa /
analyzed: tshig kyang brnangs bzhin du ngal nas smras pa /
translated: He was exhausted and spoke with difficulty:

original: pha bdag ni byang phyogs na rdo 'jog gi grong khyer de nas sngon gyi las kyis 'dir bde bar phyin na /
analyzed: pha bdag ni byang phyogs na rdo 'jog gi grong khyer de nas sngon gyi las kyis 'dir bde bar phyin na /
translated: “Father, I am from the city of Takṣaśilā in the north. I have come here by the power of my previous karma.

original: da ni gar mchi yang ma 'tshal te /
analyzed: da ni gar mchi yang ma 'tshal te /
translated: I do not know where I am now.

original: bar ma dor dus las 'da' ba zhig tu 'gyur yang ma 'tshal to //🔽zhes smras pa dang / des de'i nyams dang tshig gi rgyud thos te /
analyzed: bar ma dor dus las 'da' ba zhig tu 'gyur yang ma 'tshal to // zhes smras pa dang / des de'i nyams dang tshig gi rgyud thos te /
translated: I do not know if I will die in this place.”🔽The householder Gautama heard the story of his experience and his words.

original: khyim bdag go'u ta mas de la yid kyis sdug par gyur te /
analyzed: khyim bdag go'u ta mas de la yid kyis sdug par gyur te /
translated: He felt pity for him.

original: bu rdo 'jog na gnas pa'i skye bo mang po dag khyod kyis shes sam zhes dris so //
analyzed: bu rdo 'jog na gnas pa'i skye bo mang po dag khyod kyis shes sam zhes dris so //
translated: “Son, do you know the many people who live in Takṣaśilā?”

original: pha 'tshal lo //🔽bu khyim bdag @191a *//
analyzed: pha 'tshal lo // bu khyim bdag @191a *//
translated: “Father, I know them.”

original: 'di zhes bya ba khyod kyis shes sam /
analyzed: 'di zhes bya ba khyod kyis shes sam /
translated: “Son, do you know a householder named so-and-so?”

original: pha de ni bdag skal pa nyams pa'i pha lags te /
analyzed: pha de ni bdag skal pa nyams pa'i pha lags te /
translated: “Father, he is my father, but my good fortune has declined.”

original: 'tshal to // khyim bdag go'u ta ma'i yid la yang shin tu sdug par gyur nas /
analyzed: 'tshal to // khyim bdag go'u ta ma'i yid la yang shin tu sdug par gyur nas /
translated: The householder Gautama was also very pleased with her.

original: bu mi dga' bar bya mi dgos kyi /
analyzed: bu mi dga' bar bya mi dgos kyi /
translated: You don't need to be unhappy, my daughter.

original: ma ngu zhig /
analyzed: ma ngu zhig /
translated: Don't cry.

original: khyod ni nga'i mag par 'gyur te /
analyzed: khyod ni nga'i mag par 'gyur te /
translated: You will be my son-in-law.

original: khyim 'di dag khyod nyid kyi yin no zhes smras te /
analyzed: khyim 'di dag khyod nyid kyi yin no zhes smras te /
translated: This house is yours.

original: de yang spro bsrings te /
analyzed: de yang spro bsrings te /
translated: He comforted her.

original: de yang mi dga' ba dang bral lo //
analyzed: de yang mi dga' ba dang bral lo //
translated: She was free from unhappiness.

original: khyim bdag go'u ta mas byug pa dang / bza' ba dang / btung ba dang / gos dang / rgyan dang / khyim dang / mal stan dang / g-yog dang / dga' ba'i tshig gis ngal bsos te /
analyzed: khyim bdag go'u ta mas byug pa dang / bza' ba dang / btung ba dang / gos dang / rgyan dang / khyim dang / mal stan dang / g-yog dang / dga' ba'i tshig gis ngal bsos te /
translated: The householder Gautama comforted her with ointments, food, drink, clothes, ornaments, a house, a bed, servants, and pleasant words.

original: chung ma la smras pa /
analyzed: chung ma la smras pa /
translated: He said to his wife,

original: bzang mo khyod kyi mag pa 'ongs te /
analyzed: bzang mo khyod kyi mag pa 'ongs te /
translated: 'My dear, your son-in-law has come.

original: bu mo bag mar btang gi sta gon byos shig /
analyzed: bu mo bag mar btang gi sta gon byos shig /
translated: Prepare for the daughter's marriage.

original: des de'i nyi ma dang / tshes grangs dang / skad cig ma dang / skar ma dag brtags te /
analyzed: des de'i nyi ma dang / tshes grangs dang / skad cig ma dang / skar ma dag brtags te /
translated: She examined the day, lunar mansion, moment, and star,

original: rim bzhin du bshams nas /
analyzed: rim bzhin du bshams nas /
translated: and made preparations in order.

original: phu nu dang / mdza' bo dang / gnyen bshes su bcas pas bu mo long zhig ces smras pa dang / des pa skad cig mi blang gi /
analyzed: phu nu dang / mdza' bo dang / gnyen bshes su bcas pas bu mo long zhig ces smras pa dang / des pa skad cig mi blang gi /
translated: But he said, I will not take her right away.🔽I will seek out wealth.

original: nor rnams je btsal bar bya'o zhes smras pa dang / des bu khyim na nor yod pa 'di dag thams cad khyod kyi yin na /
analyzed: nor rnams je btsal bar bya'o zhes smras pa dang / des bu khyim na nor yod pa 'di dag thams cad khyod kyi yin na /
translated: She said, Son, all this wealth in the house is yours.

original: nor gyis ci zhig bya /
analyzed: nor gyis ci zhig bya /
translated: What will you do with wealth?

original: zhes smras pa dang / de yang smad 'tshong ma de la khon lan glon par 'dod nas smras pa /
analyzed: zhes smras pa dang / de yang smad 'tshong ma de la khon lan glon par 'dod nas smras pa /
translated: He wanted to retaliate against the prostitute and said,

original: pha de ni de ltar lags mod kyi /
analyzed: pha de ni de ltar lags mod kyi /
translated: That is true of my father,🔽 but I will not take a wife like a low-class man.

original: bdag mi ma rabs bzhin du bag ma mi len no zhes smras pa dang / de cang mi zer bar 'dug go //
analyzed: bdag mi ma rabs bzhin du bag ma mi len no zhes smras pa dang / de cang mi zer bar 'dug go //
translated: She sat there without saying anything.

original: de 'khor mo 'jig nas @191b byung ste /🔽yan man du 'khyam zhing 'dug pa las chu 'gram du song ba dang / chu de'i nang nas mi ro zhig khyer 'ongs nas /
analyzed: de 'khor mo 'jig nas @191b byung ste / yan man du 'khyam zhing 'dug pa las chu 'gram du song ba dang / chu de'i nang nas mi ro zhig khyer 'ongs nas /
translated: After some time had passed,🔽he went to the bank of a river while wandering around. A human corpse was carried down the river.

original: bya rog gcig chu'i 'gram de na 'dug nas mi ro za bar 'dod na mchus ma slebs so //
analyzed: bya rog gcig chu'i 'gram de na 'dug nas mi ro za bar 'dod na mchus ma slebs so //
translated: A crow was sitting on the bank of the river. It wanted to eat the human corpse but its beak could not penetrate it.

original: de nas mchu de shing bu zhig la brdor ba dang / ring po zhig tu gyur te des ro de zos so //
analyzed: de nas mchu de shing bu zhig la brdor ba dang / ring po zhig tu gyur te des ro de zos so //
translated: Then he rubbed his beak on a stick, and it became long, and he ate the corpse.

original: de nas yang des shing gzhan zhig la mchu brdar ba dang / ji ltar snga ma bzhin du gyur to; ;ded dpon des kyang lag pas shing bu de gnyis blangs te /
analyzed: de nas yang des shing gzhan zhig la mchu brdar ba dang / ji ltar snga ma bzhin du gyur to; ;ded dpon des kyang lag pas shing bu de gnyis blangs te /
translated: Then he rubbed his beak on another stick, and it became as before. The captain took the two sticks in his hand

original: khyim du song ngo //
analyzed: khyim du song ngo //
translated: and went home.

original: de nas karsha pa na lnga brgya khyer nas smad tshong ma de'i khyim du song ste /
analyzed: de nas karsha pa na lnga brgya khyer nas smad tshong ma de'i khyim du song ste /
translated: Then he took five hundred kārṣāpaṇas and went to the courtesan’s house.

original: bzang mo khyod kyis bdag la karsha pa na med pa'o zhes bskrad na /🔽de ni karsha pa na 'di re yongs su spyad kyi /
analyzed: bzang mo khyod kyis bdag la karsha pa na med pa'o zhes bskrad na / de ni karsha pa na 'di re yongs su spyad kyi /
translated: “Good lady, you turned me away, saying, ‘I have no kārṣāpaṇas.’🔽Here are the kārṣāpaṇas. Let’s enjoy ourselves.”

original: tshur shog ces smras pa dang / de yang karsha pa na la chags nas de dang lhan cig tu yongs su spyad do //
analyzed: tshur shog ces smras pa dang / de yang karsha pa na la chags nas de dang lhan cig tu yongs su spyad do //
translated: She was attached to the kārṣāpaṇas, and they enjoyed themselves together.

original: de nas ded dpon des de la yongs su spyad de /
analyzed: de nas ded dpon des de la yongs su spyad de /
translated: Then the captain enjoyed himself with her.

original: de'i sna shing bu des brdar ba dang / shin tu ring bar gyur nas /
analyzed: de'i sna shing bu des brdar ba dang / shin tu ring bar gyur nas /
translated: He rubbed his nose with the stick, and it became very long.

original: des sman pa thams cad bkug ste bstan na yang /
analyzed: des sman pa thams cad bkug ste bstan na yang /
translated: He summoned all the physicians and showed them to them,

original: de dag gis sman dpyad bya bar ma nus te /
analyzed: de dag gis sman dpyad bya bar ma nus te /
translated: but they were unable to diagnose the illness.

original: de ltar de sman pa thams cad kyis spangs pa dang / des ded dpon la jo bo bzod par gsol /
analyzed: de ltar de sman pa thams cad kyis spangs pa dang / des ded dpon la jo bo bzod par gsol /
translated: When all the physicians had given up on him, he said to the caravan leader, Master, I beg your forgiveness.

original: 'di'i sman dpyad mdzod cig /🔽ces smras pa dang / des smras pa /
analyzed: 'di'i sman dpyad mdzod cig / ces smras pa dang / des smras pa /
translated: Please treat me.

original: de ste khyer ba de kun slar sbyin par dam 'cha' na gdod bya'o //
analyzed: de ste khyer ba de kun slar sbyin par dam 'cha' na gdod bya'o //
translated: The caravan leader said, If you promise to return all that you have taken, I will do it.🔽She said, Master, I will return it all, so please treat me.

original: mos jo bo nyi rim du yang slar dbul gyi mdzod cig ces smras pa dang / des shing bu gnyis pas brdar na ji ltar snga ma bzhin du gyur te /🔽des zong @192a *//
analyzed: mos jo bo nyi rim du yang slar dbul gyi mdzod cig ces smras pa dang / des shing bu gnyis pas brdar na ji ltar snga ma bzhin du gyur te / des zong @192a *//
translated: He said, If you are able to cut it with two sticks, it will be as before.

original: ci khyer ba thams cad de la slar byin no //
analyzed: ci khyer ba thams cad de la slar byin no //
translated: She returned all the goods that she had taken.

original: de nas ded dpon des bu mo skem mo go'u ta mi dpal chen po dang sbyar te bag mar blangs so //
analyzed: de nas ded dpon des bu mo skem mo go'u ta mi dpal chen po dang sbyar te bag mar blangs so //
translated: Then the caravan leader married the emaciated girl Gautami with great pomp and ceremony.

original: khyim bdag go'u ta ma ri brags kyi grong gzhan zhig na zhing rmed de /
analyzed: khyim bdag go'u ta ma ri brags kyi grong gzhan zhig na zhing rmed de /
translated: The householder Gautama was plowing in another village in the countryside.

original: des mag pa de la smras pa /
analyzed: des mag pa de la smras pa /
translated: He said to his son-in-law,

original: bu khyod kyi chung ma 'di khrid la ri brags kyi grong 'di zhes bya bar 'dug cig /
analyzed: bu khyod kyi chung ma 'di khrid la ri brags kyi grong 'di zhes bya bar 'dug cig /
translated: “Son, take this wife of yours and go to live in the town of Rājagṛha.”

original: des de la ri brags kyi grong gi zhing thams cad byin nas /
analyzed: des de la ri brags kyi grong gi zhing thams cad byin nas /
translated: He gave her all the fields in the town of Rājagṛha.

original: de skem mo go'u ta mi shing rta la bskyon te /
analyzed: de skem mo go'u ta mi shing rta la bskyon te /
translated: He put the hunchback Gautamī in a chariot

original: der song nas 'dug go /🔽de dang lhan cig rtse dga' yongs su spyad do //
analyzed: der song nas 'dug go / de dang lhan cig rtse dga' yongs su spyad do //
translated: and they went and lived there.🔽He took pleasure in her and enjoyed himself with her.

original: de de la rtse dga' yongs su spyod pa las /
analyzed: de de la rtse dga' yongs su spyod pa las /
translated: As he took pleasure in her and enjoyed himself with her,

original: dus phyi zhig na skem mo go'u ta mi sems can dang ldan par gyur nas /
analyzed: dus phyi zhig na skem mo go'u ta mi sems can dang ldan par gyur nas /
translated: after some time the hunchback Gautamī became pregnant.

original: de bu 'byung ba'i dus la bab pa dang / jo bo bdag gi bu btsar nyes /
analyzed: de bu 'byung ba'i dus la bab pa dang / jo bo bdag gi bu btsar nyes /
translated: When the time came for her to give birth, she said, “Lord, my child is about to be born.

original: bdag gnyen gyi khyim du mchi'o //
analyzed: bdag gnyen gyi khyim du mchi'o //
translated: I must go to my parents’ home.

original: der bdag la bdag gi mas bdag gi g-yog bgyid do zhes smras pa dang / des kyang legs so //
analyzed: der bdag la bdag gi mas bdag gi g-yog bgyid do zhes smras pa dang / des kyang legs so //
translated: My mother will serve me there.”

original: zhes smras nas /
analyzed: zhes smras nas /
translated: He said, “Very well.”

original: des bu mo gnyen gyi khyim du bskyal ba dang / de la der btsas na bu khye'u zhig byung nas zhag bdun gsum nyi shu rtsa gcig tu btsas pa'i bcas ston rgyas par byas te /
analyzed: des bu mo gnyen gyi khyim du bskyal ba dang / de la der btsas na bu khye'u zhig byung nas zhag bdun gsum nyi shu rtsa gcig tu btsas pa'i bcas ston rgyas par byas te /
translated: For twenty-one days they celebrated the birth of the son.

original: rigs dang mthun pa'i ming btags nas /
analyzed: rigs dang mthun pa'i ming btags nas /
translated: They gave him a name in accordance with his family.

original: des khye'u de khyer te slar ri brags de nyid du 'ongs so //
analyzed: des khye'u de khyer te slar ri brags de nyid du 'ongs so //
translated: Then she took the boy and returned to the same mountain village.

original: de phyis yang sems can dang ldan par gyur nas /
analyzed: de phyis yang sems can dang ldan par gyur nas /
translated: Later, she became pregnant again.

original: bu 'byung ba'i dus su bab pa dang / jo bo bu 'byung ba'i dus la bab kyi /
analyzed: bu 'byung ba'i dus su bab pa dang / jo bo bu 'byung ba'i dus la bab kyi /
translated: When the time came for her to give birth, she said to her husband, “Lord, the time has come for me to give birth.

original: gnyen gyi khyim du mchi'o //
analyzed: gnyen gyi khyim du mchi'o //
translated: I must go to my parents’ house.”🔽Her mother said, “I will serve you.”

original: der @192b bdag la mas bdag gi g-yog bgyid do zhes smras pa dang / des kyang bzang mo legs kyi dong bar bya'o //
analyzed: der @192b bdag la mas bdag gi g-yog bgyid do zhes smras pa dang / des kyang bzang mo legs kyi dong bar bya'o //
translated: He said, “Very well, let’s go.”🔽They loaded her and her son into a cart and set out.

original: zhes smras pa dang / des ma dang bur bcas te shing rta la bskyon nas dong ba dang / de lam gyi phyed du bu btsas par gyur to //
analyzed: zhes smras pa dang / des ma dang bur bcas te shing rta la bskyon nas dong ba dang / de lam gyi phyed du bu btsas par gyur to //
translated: On the way, she gave birth to a son.

original: des bu btsas pa mthong nas /
analyzed: des bu btsas pa mthong nas /
translated: When she saw that she had given birth to a son, she said to her husband, “Lord, I have given birth to a son.

original: shing rta las babs te shing gzhan zhig gi drung du 'dug pa dang / de nyid du gnyid kyis log go //
analyzed: shing rta las babs te shing gzhan zhig gi drung du 'dug pa dang / de nyid du gnyid kyis log go //
translated: He got down from the chariot and sat down in front of a tree, and he fell asleep right there.

original: de gnyid kyis cher log pa dang / sbrul gdug pas zin nas dus las 'das so //
analyzed: de gnyid kyis cher log pa dang / sbrul gdug pas zin nas dus las 'das so //
translated: When he was fast asleep, he was bitten by a poisonous snake and died.

original: mo yang shing rta'i steng de nyid du khye'u zhig btsas te /
analyzed: mo yang shing rta'i steng de nyid du khye'u zhig btsas te /
translated: The woman gave birth to a boy right there on the chariot.

original: de shing rta las babs nas shing drung du song ste /
analyzed: de shing rta las babs nas shing drung du song ste /
translated: He got down from the chariot and went to the tree.

original: jo bo khyod kyi bu khye'u zhig btsas kyi dgyes pa skyed cig /
analyzed: jo bo khyod kyi bu khye'u zhig btsas kyi dgyes pa skyed cig /
translated: “Lord, you have a son. Rejoice!”

original: ces smras pa dang / de sems med pas lan ma glan no //
analyzed: ces smras pa dang / de sems med pas lan ma glan no //
translated: But he was dead, so he did not respond.

original: des lag pas bskul te brtags na dus las 'das par mthong ngo //
analyzed: des lag pas bskul te brtags na dus las 'das par mthong ngo //
translated: She touched him with her hand and saw that he had died.

original: mo de ngu bar gyur pa dang / ba lang yang ma byin par len pas phrogs so //
analyzed: mo de ngu bar gyur pa dang / ba lang yang ma byin par len pas phrogs so //
translated: She began to cry, and someone stole the cow that had not been given to her.

original: de nas ring zhig tu dus nas mi dga' ba skyes te /
analyzed: de nas ring zhig tu dus nas mi dga' ba skyes te /
translated: After a while, she became unhappy.

original: phyogs bzhir bltas nas /
analyzed: phyogs bzhir bltas nas /
translated: She looked in the four directions

original: de bu da gzod btsas pa 'di pang du thogs /
analyzed: de bu da gzod btsas pa 'di pang du thogs /
translated: and said, “I have just given birth to a son. I will hold him in my lap.”

original: snga ma ni lag pa nas bzung ste song ba dang / de na dus ma yin pa'i sprin chen po langs te /
analyzed: snga ma ni lag pa nas bzung ste song ba dang / de na dus ma yin pa'i sprin chen po langs te /
translated: At that time a great untimely cloud arose.

original: des mtsho dang / lteng ka dang / khron pa dag chus gang nas /
analyzed: des mtsho dang / lteng ka dang / khron pa dag chus gang nas /
translated: It filled the lakes, ponds, and wells with water.

original: de'i lam ka na chu bo rgal dgos par gyur nas /
analyzed: de'i lam ka na chu bo rgal dgos par gyur nas /
translated: On his way he had to cross a river.

original: des bsams pa /🔽de ste khye'u dang lhan cig tu rgal na ni bdag kyang med /
analyzed: des bsams pa / de ste khye'u dang lhan cig tu rgal na ni bdag kyang med /
translated: He thought,🔽“If I cross with the child, I will be without the child.

original: khye'u yang med par 'gyur na /
analyzed: khye'u yang med par 'gyur na /
translated: If I am without the child,

original: re zhig khye'u je bsgral lo //
analyzed: re zhig khye'u je bsgral lo //
translated: I will first cross the child.”

original: phu bo de chu'i 'gram du bzhag ste /
analyzed: phu bo de chu'i 'gram du bzhag ste /
translated: He put the older child on the bank

original: chung du khyer te rgal lo //
analyzed: chung du khyer te rgal lo //
translated: and carried the younger one across.

original: @193a *// de nas de yang 'gram du bzhag ste /🔽bu phu bo'i phyir yang chu rgal te /
analyzed: @193a *// de nas de yang 'gram du bzhag ste / bu phu bo'i phyir yang chu rgal te /
translated: Then he put the younger one on the bank🔽and went back into the water to get the older child.

original: chu bo'i phyed du phyin pa dang / khye'u chung du de was khyer ro //
analyzed: chu bo'i phyed du phyin pa dang / khye'u chung du de was khyer ro //
translated: When he had gone halfway across the river, the younger child was carried away by a bird.

original: de nas mos chu bo'i dbus su 'dug ste /
analyzed: de nas mos chu bo'i dbus su 'dug ste /
translated: Then she, in the middle of the river,

original: lag pa g-yabs nas ku ku zhes bos pa dang / khye'u phu bo de ma bdag la 'bod do snyam bsams nas /
analyzed: lag pa g-yabs nas ku ku zhes bos pa dang / khye'u phu bo de ma bdag la 'bod do snyam bsams nas /
translated: waved her arms and called out, “Ku ku!” The older child thought, “My mother is calling me.”

analyzed: kyi hud bu chen po /

original: des bu mo //

original: de shin tu log par go'u ta mis rig nas bsams pa /
analyzed: de shin tu log par go'u ta mis rig nas bsams pa /
translated: Gautama, who was very wise, thought,🔽“

original: 'di bu bsad nas bdag la yang bu'i sha zar bcug ste /
analyzed: 'di bu bsad nas bdag la yang bu'i sha zar bcug ste /
translated: “I’ll kill my son and make you eat his flesh!”

original: mi 'di ni srin po yin gyi 'bros so //🔽snyam nas rgyags ci theg cig khyer te bros pa dang / byang phyogs kyi lam grogs dag cig yul 'khor mo 'jig tu zong rnams btsongs te /
analyzed: mi 'di ni srin po yin gyi 'bros so // snyam nas rgyags ci theg cig khyer te bros pa dang / byang phyogs kyi lam grogs dag cig yul 'khor mo 'jig tu zong rnams btsongs te /
translated: “This man is a demon! I’ll run away!”🔽She took as much food as she could carry and fled.🔽She met some merchants from the north who were selling their wares in the city of Vārāṇasī.

original: slar gyis zong rnams khyer nas byang phyogs kyi lam du zhugs te dong ba dang lhan cig tu song ngo //
analyzed: slar gyis zong rnams khyer nas byang phyogs kyi lam du zhugs te dong ba dang lhan cig tu song ngo //
translated: They bought some goods and set out on the northern road.

original: ji tsam na ded dpon gyis de'i gzugs mdzes pa mthong ngo //
analyzed: ji tsam na ded dpon gyis de'i gzugs mdzes pa mthong ngo //
translated: The caravan leader saw that she was beautiful.

original: mthong nas de la chags te /🔽des khyod su'i /
analyzed: mthong nas de la chags te / des khyod su'i /
translated: He became attached to her.🔽He asked her, “Who are you?

original: da gang du 'gro zhes dris pa dang / mos smras pa /
analyzed: da gang du 'gro zhes dris pa dang / mos smras pa /
translated: Where are you going?”

original: ded dpon / bdag gi khyo ni sbrul gdug pas zos so //
analyzed: ded dpon / bdag gi khyo ni sbrul gdug pas zos so //
translated: She said, “Caravan leader, my husband was eaten by a poisonous snake.

original: bu gnyis las gcig ni was zos so //
analyzed: bu gnyis las gcig ni was zos so //
translated: Of my two sons, one was eaten by a wolf,

original: gcig ni chu'i nang du dus las 'das so //
analyzed: gcig ni chu'i nang du dus las 'das so //
translated: and one died in the water.

original: pha dang ma ni gnam lcags kyis bsad do //🔽bdag ni mgon @196a *//
analyzed: pha dang ma ni gnam lcags kyis bsad do // bdag ni mgon @196a *//
translated: My father and mother were killed by lightning.

original: med pas gar dga' bar 'gro ste /
analyzed: med pas gar dga' bar 'gro ste /
translated: I have no protector. I’m going wherever I like.”

original: mgron pa mang po de dag gar dong ba der mchi'o //
analyzed: mgron pa mang po de dag gar dong ba der mchi'o //
translated: I will go wherever those many guests go.”

original: des bsams pa /
analyzed: des bsams pa /
translated: He thought,

analyzed: ring du gar song yang 'di 'dra ba'i bud med dang lhan cig yongs su spyod do snyam nas des de chung mar byas te /
translated: “No matter how far I go, I will enjoy myself with a woman like this.” He took her as his wife.

original: ji tsam zhig na mgron pa mang po de dag mi rgod kyis bcom ste /
analyzed: ji tsam zhig na mgron pa mang po de dag mi rgod kyis bcom ste /
translated: After some time, those many guests were robbed by bandits,

original: ded dpon de yang 'thab pa las bsad do //
analyzed: ded dpon de yang 'thab pa las bsad do //
translated: and the caravan leader was killed in the fighting.

original: skem mo go'u ta mi ni mi rgod kyi ded dpon gyis chung mar byas pa dang / mi rgod kyi ded dpon de yang byang phyogs kyi rgyal pos bsad do //
analyzed: skem mo go'u ta mi ni mi rgod kyi ded dpon gyis chung mar byas pa dang / mi rgod kyi ded dpon de yang byang phyogs kyi rgyal pos bsad do //
translated: Gautami the emaciated woman was taken as the wife of the leader of the bandits, and that leader of the bandits was killed by the king of the north.

original: skem mo go'u ta mi ni rgyal po'i btsun mor gyur to //
analyzed: skem mo go'u ta mi ni rgyal po'i btsun mor gyur to //

original: ji tsam na rgyal po de yang dus las 'das nas /
analyzed: ji tsam na rgyal po de yang dus las 'das nas /
translated: After some time, the king died.

original: btsun mo dang / gzhon nu dang / blon po dang / skye bo mang po dag gis de skem mo go'u ta mi dang lhan cig tu bkur sti cher byas te /
analyzed: btsun mo dang / gzhon nu dang / blon po dang / skye bo mang po dag gis de skem mo go'u ta mi dang lhan cig tu bkur sti cher byas te /
translated: The queen, princes, ministers, and many people, together with Gautami the emaciated woman, made great offerings to him

original: mchad pa'i nang du bcug go /
analyzed: mchad pa'i nang du bcug go /
translated: and placed him in a stupa.

original: byang phyogs kyi mi rnams dur rku ste /
analyzed: byang phyogs kyi mi rnams dur rku ste /
translated: The people of the north were grave robbers.🔽When they dug up the grave, Gautami the emaciated woman came out of the ground.

original: de dag gis mchad pa brus pa dang / skem mo go'u ta mi snar rdul song nas des sbrid pa byung ba dang / dur rku ba'i mi rnams skrag ste /
analyzed: de dag gis mchad pa brus pa dang / skem mo go'u ta mi snar rdul song nas des sbrid pa byung ba dang / dur rku ba'i mi rnams skrag ste /

original: ro langs so snyam nas de dag bros pa dang / skem mo go'u ta mi khung bu brus nas byung ngo //
analyzed: ro langs so snyam nas de dag bros pa dang / skem mo go'u ta mi khung bu brus nas byung ngo //
translated: They ran away, and Gautami the emaciated woman came out of the hole.

original: des sdug bsngal rnam pa du mar brtags pas rlung rab tu langs shing kha zas med pa'i rkyen gyis smyon mar gyur nas des smad g-yogs bor te /
analyzed: des sdug bsngal rnam pa du mar brtags pas rlung rab tu langs shing kha zas med pa'i rkyen gyis smyon mar gyur nas des smad g-yogs bor te /

original: lag pa dang rkang pa gas shing @196b rtsub; skra ring zhing skya mo seng seng mor gyur te /
analyzed: lag pa dang rkang pa gas shing @196b rtsub; skra ring zhing skya mo seng seng mor gyur te /

original: phan tshun 'khyams 'khyams pa las mnyan yod du phyin to //
analyzed: phan tshun 'khyams 'khyams pa las mnyan yod du phyin to //
translated: Wandering around, she came to Śrāvastī.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: sems can rnams kyi las kyi rnam par smin pa ni bsam gyis mi khyab bo //
analyzed: sems can rnams kyi las kyi rnam par smin pa ni bsam gyis mi khyab bo //
translated: “The ripening of the karma of sentient beings is inconceivable.”

original: des sngon las byas pa rnams kyi 'bras bu rnam par smin pa myong bar gyur nas /
analyzed: des sngon las byas pa rnams kyi 'bras bu rnam par smin pa myong bar gyur nas /
translated: Having experienced the ripening of the results of his previous actions,

original: sngon gyi las kyis dze ta'i tshal du phyin to //
analyzed: sngon gyi las kyis dze ta'i tshal du phyin to //
translated: he went to Jetavana due to his previous karma.

original: de'i tshe bcom ldan 'das dge slong brgya stong du ma'i mdun na chos 'chad cing bzhugs pa skem mo go'u ta mis rgyang ma nas /
analyzed: de'i tshe bcom ldan 'das dge slong brgya stong du ma'i mdun na chos 'chad cing bzhugs pa skem mo go'u ta mis rgyang ma nas /
translated: At that time, the Blessed One was teaching the Dharma in front of many hundreds of thousands of monks. Gautama the emaciated one saw from afar

analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das skyes bu chen po'i mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis kyis ni yang dag par brgyan /
translated: the Blessed Buddha, his body adorned with the thirty-two marks of a great being,

original: dpe byed bzang po brgyad cus ni sku la rnam par spras /
analyzed: dpe byed bzang po brgyad cus ni sku la rnam par spras /
translated: his body resplendent with the eighty minor marks,

analyzed: 'od kyi dkyil 'khor nyi ma stong las 'das pa'i 'od 'dom gang ba rin po che'i ri 'gro ba bzhin kho ra khor yug nas bzang ba mthong ngo //

original: mthong nas kyang bdag gi sems dran pa slar thob ste /
analyzed: mthong nas kyang bdag gi sems dran pa slar thob ste /
translated: Having seen him, his mind regained mindfulness.

original: de ngo tsha ba'i tshul du gyur nas phyogs gcig tu tsog pur 'dug go /
analyzed: de ngo tsha ba'i tshul du gyur nas phyogs gcig tu tsog pur 'dug go /

analyzed: de'i bar du yang sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyis mi mkhyen pa'am /
translated: In the meantime, there is nothing whatsoever that the Bhagavān Buddha does not know,

original: mi gzigs pa'am /🔽mi rig pa'am /
analyzed: mi gzigs pa'am / mi rig pa'am /
translated: does not see,🔽does not understand,

original: rnam par mi rig pa cung zad kyang med de /
analyzed: rnam par mi rig pa cung zad kyang med de /

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni /

original: chos nyid kyi thugs rje chen pos 'jig rten la phan 'dogs par gyur pa /
analyzed: chos nyid kyi thugs rje chen pos 'jig rten la phan 'dogs par gyur pa /
translated: is one who benefits the world through the great compassion of reality.

analyzed: srung ba gcig pu dpa' bo gcig pu gnyis su mad pa gnyis su mi smra ba /
translated: He is the sole protector, the sole hero, the nondual, the one who does not speak dualistically,

original: zhi gnas dang lhag mthong la gnas pa /
analyzed: zhi gnas dang lhag mthong la gnas pa /
translated: he is one who abides in śamatha and vipaśyanā,

original: gdul ba'i dngos po gsum la mkhas pa /
analyzed: gdul ba'i dngos po gsum la mkhas pa /
translated: he is one who is skilled in the three things to be tamed,

original: chu bo bzhi las @197a *//
analyzed: chu bo bzhi las @197a *//

analyzed: rgal ba / rdzu 'phrul gyis rkang pa bzhi'i mthil rab tu brtan pa /

analyzed: mi 'jigs pa bzhis bsnyengs pa med pa /
translated: he is one who is fearless through the four fearlessnesses,

original: yan lag lnga rnam par spangs pa /
analyzed: yan lag lnga rnam par spangs pa /

original: 'gro ba lnga las yang dag par 'das pa /
analyzed: 'gro ba lnga las yang dag par 'das pa /

original: yan lag drug dang ldan pa /
analyzed: yan lag drug dang ldan pa /

original: pha rol tu phyin pa drug yongs su rdzogs pa /
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa drug yongs su rdzogs pa /

original: gnas drug la rtag tu gnas pa /
analyzed: gnas drug la rtag tu gnas pa /

original: byang chub kyi yan lag bdun gyi me tog gis brgyan pa /
analyzed: byang chub kyi yan lag bdun gyi me tog gis brgyan pa /

analyzed: lam gyi yan lag brgyad 'chang ba /

original: mthar gyis snyoms par 'jug pa dgu la mkhas pa /
analyzed: mthar gyis snyoms par 'jug pa dgu la mkhas pa /
translated: skilled in the nine successive absorptions,

original: stobs bcu'i stobs dang ldan pa /
analyzed: stobs bcu'i stobs dang ldan pa /
translated: endowed with the power of the ten powers,

analyzed: gang gnod par 'gyur /

analyzed: gang sdug bsngal ba dang / dog pa dang / gnod par 'gyur / gang ngan song la gzhol / gang ngan song la 'bab /

analyzed: gang ngan song la rab tu bab /

original: ngas gang ngan song nas phyung ste /
analyzed: ngas gang ngan song nas phyung ste /

original: gang smin pa rnams rnam par grol bar bya /
analyzed: gang smin pa rnams rnam par grol bar bya /
translated: I will liberate those who have ripened.

original: yang gsungs pa /
analyzed: yang gsungs pa /
translated: It is also said:

original: @197b rgya mtsho chu srin gnas de yang //
analyzed: @197b rgya mtsho chu srin gnas de yang //
translated: “Even the ocean, the abode of sea monsters,

original: gal te dus las yol yang srid //🔽gdul bar 'gyur ba'i sras rnams la //
analyzed: gal te dus las yol yang srid // gdul bar 'gyur ba'i sras rnams la //
translated: may, at some point, go dry,

original: sangs rgyas dus las 'da' mi 'gyur //
analyzed: sangs rgyas dus las 'da' mi 'gyur //
translated: but the Buddha will not pass beyond the time🔽for those disciples who are ready to be tamed.”

analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bo la bka' stsal pa /
translated: Then the Blessed One said to the venerable Ānanda:

analyzed: kun dga' bo /
translated: “Ānanda,

analyzed: ded dpon gyi chung ma skem mo go'u ta mi la bla gos byin cig dang / 'di la chos bshad par bya'o //

analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bos ded dpon gyi chung ma skem mo go'u ta mi la bla gos byin no //
translated: The venerable Ānanda gave his upper robe to the merchant’s wife Kṛmigautmi.

original: de nas ded dpon gyi chung ma skem mo go'u ta mis bla gos gyon nas /
analyzed: de nas ded dpon gyi chung ma skem mo go'u ta mis bla gos gyon nas /
translated: Then the merchant’s wife, the emaciated Gautami, put on her upper robe,

original: bcom ldan 'das gang na bder song ste /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das gang na bder song ste /
translated: went to the Blessed One,

original: bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs la mgo bos phyag 'tshal te phyogs gcig tu 'dug go /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs la mgo bos phyag 'tshal te phyogs gcig tu 'dug go /
translated: and after prostrating her head at the Blessed One’s feet, she sat to one side.

analyzed: phyogs gcig tu 'dug pa dang / de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis de'i bsam pa dang / bag la nyal ba dang / khams dang / rang bzhin rnams mkhyen nas /
translated: When she had sat to one side, the Blessed One, knowing her thoughts, tendencies, disposition, and nature,

analyzed: 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi yang dag par rtogs par 'gyur ba de lta bu'i chos bshad de /

original: gang thos pas ded dpon gyi chung ma skem mo go'u ta mis /
analyzed: gang thos pas ded dpon gyi chung ma skem mo go'u ta mis /
translated: When she heard it, the merchant’s wife, the emaciated Gautami,

analyzed: 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i ri'i rtse mo nyi shu gyen du byung ba ye shes kyi rdo rje bcom nas /
translated: crushed with the vajra of wisdom the twenty high peaks of the mountain of views concerning the transitory collection,

original: rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu mngon du byas so //
analyzed: rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu mngon du byas so //
translated: and she manifested the resultant state of stream entry.

original: de bden pa mthong nas stan las langs te /
analyzed: de bden pa mthong nas stan las langs te /
translated: Having seen the truths, she rose from her seat,

original: bcom ldan 'das ga la ba der logs su thal mo sbyar te phyag 'tshal nas /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ga la ba der logs su thal mo sbyar te phyag 'tshal nas /
translated: He bowed to the Bhagavat with his palms together and said:

original: bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: She bowed to the Blessed One with palms joined and said:

original: btsun pa legs par bshad pa'i chos 'dul ba la rab tu byung zhing /
analyzed: btsun pa legs par bshad pa'i chos 'dul ba la rab tu byung zhing /
translated: “Blessed One, may I be allowed to go forth in the well-taught Dharma and Vinaya,

original: bsnyen @198a *// par rdzogs te /
analyzed: bsnyen @198a *// par rdzogs te /
translated: complete my novitiate,

original: dge slong ma'i dngos por 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: dge slong ma'i dngos por 'gyur zhing /
translated: and receive full ordination.

analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyi drung du bdag tshangs par spyad pa spyod du gnang ngam /
translated: May I be allowed to practice pure conduct in the presence of the Blessed One.”

analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis skye dgu'i bdag mo chen mo la gtad nas des rab tu phyung ste /

original: bsnyen par rdzogs par byas nas /
analyzed: bsnyen par rdzogs par byas nas /

original: 'dul ba la bslabs te lung bsgo ba byin nas /🔽de brtson par byas /
analyzed: 'dul ba la bslabs te lung bsgo ba byin nas / de brtson par byas /
translated: She trained in the Vinaya, received the instructions,

original: nan tan tu byas /
analyzed: nan tan tu byas /
translated: and applied herself with diligence.

original: bsgrub par byas pas na 'khor ba'i 'khor lo 'di g-yo ba dang / mi g-yo bar shes te /
analyzed: bsgrub par byas pas na 'khor ba'i 'khor lo 'di g-yo ba dang / mi g-yo bar shes te /
translated: She practiced and accomplished them, and so she understood the turning and not turning of the wheel of saṃsāra.

original: 'dus byas kyi rgyud thams cad zhig pa dang / ltung pa dang / rnam par gyes pa /
analyzed: 'dus byas kyi rgyud thams cad zhig pa dang / ltung pa dang / rnam par gyes pa /
translated: All conditioned things are subject to destruction, fall, separation, and disintegration.

original: rnam par 'jig pa'i chos nyid kyis rab tu bcom ste /
analyzed: rnam par 'jig pa'i chos nyid kyis rab tu bcom ste /
translated: He was completely destroyed by the nature of destruction.

original: nyon mongs pa thams cad spangs nas dgra bcom pa mngon du byas te /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa thams cad spangs nas dgra bcom pa mngon du byas te /
translated: Having abandoned all afflictions, he manifested arhatship.

original: dgra bcom par gyur to //
analyzed: dgra bcom par gyur to //
translated: He became an arhat.

original: khams gsum gyi 'dod chags dang bral ba /
analyzed: khams gsum gyi 'dod chags dang bral ba /

analyzed: bong ba dang gser du 'dra ba / nam mkha' dang lag mthil ltar chags pa med pa bzhin du sems mnyam pa ste /

analyzed: ste'u dang tsan dan du 'dra bar rig pas sgo nga'i sbubs bcom pa /
translated: He had destroyed the shell of ignorance, and was like sandalwood or a balm.

original: rig pa dang / mngon par shes pa yang dag par so sor rig pa ni thob /

original: de zla ba brgyad dam dgu 'das pa dang / khye'u zhig btsas so //
analyzed: de zla ba brgyad dam dgu 'das pa dang / khye'u zhig btsas so //
translated: After eight or nine months had passed, she gave birth to a boy.

original: de btsas pa'i btsas ston rgya cher byas te /
analyzed: de btsas pa'i btsas ston rgya cher byas te /
translated: They held a great feast for the birth

original: rigs dang mthun pa las ming btags so //
analyzed: rigs dang mthun pa las ming btags so //
translated: and gave him a name in accordance with his family.

original: de sngon gyi las kyis 'di btsas na sems can 'di @201a *//
analyzed: de sngon gyi las kyis 'di btsas na sems can 'di @201a *//
translated: “Because of his past karma, this child

original: ma yar mo 'dis mi gsod pa la pan gyi /
analyzed: ma yar mo 'dis mi gsod pa la pan gyi /
translated: will be killed by this wet nurse.

original: de bas na 'di nyid la gzhar ro zhes bsams nas /
analyzed: de bas na 'di nyid la gzhar ro zhes bsams nas /
translated: Therefore, I will kill him myself.”

original: des de la smras pa /
analyzed: des de la smras pa /
translated: She said to her,

original: che zhe khye'u 'di khyod dang bdag gi yin gyi /
analyzed: che zhe khye'u 'di khyod dang bdag gi yin gyi /
translated: “Sister, this child is yours and mine.

original: 'di bdag cag gnyis kas bskyed do //
analyzed: 'di bdag cag gnyis kas bskyed do //
translated: We both gave birth to him.”

original: des legs kyi 'di bzhin bgyi'o zhes smras nas /
analyzed: des legs kyi 'di bzhin bgyi'o zhes smras nas /
translated: “That’s right,” she said. “I’ll do it.”

original: de skyed pa la zhugs so //
analyzed: de skyed pa la zhugs so //
translated: She began to raise him.

original: des de bskyed na log par rtog pa skyes te /
analyzed: des de bskyed na log par rtog pa skyes te /
translated: As she was raising him, a wrong idea arose in her mind:

original: gang gi bu yin pa de'i khyim ste /
analyzed: gang gi bu yin pa de'i khyim ste /
translated: “Whose son he is, that is his family.

original: de bas na 'di bskyed kyang 'di ltar khyim gyi bdag por gyur pa dang / bdag ni bran mor 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: de bas na 'di bskyed kyang 'di ltar khyim gyi bdag por gyur pa dang / bdag ni bran mor 'gyur gyi /
translated: “Therefore, even though I gave birth to him, he has become the master of the house, and I have become a slave.

original: 'di ni gsad do snyam nas /
analyzed: 'di ni gsad do snyam nas /
translated: I will kill him.”

original: de log par rtog pas bskyod pas khye'u de'i khar smyug ma'i thur ma zhig btsugs pa dang / des sdug bsngal gyis gzir bas ngu bar gyur nas /
analyzed: de log par rtog pas bskyod pas khye'u de'i khar smyug ma'i thur ma zhig btsugs pa dang / des sdug bsngal gyis gzir bas ngu bar gyur nas /
translated: “She was disturbed by these wrong thoughts. She put a bamboo sliver in the boy’s mouth, and he cried out in pain.

original: des smras pa /
analyzed: des smras pa /
translated: She said,

original: che zhe khye'u 'di ci'i phyir du /
analyzed: che zhe khye'u 'di ci'i phyir du /
translated: ‘Sister, why is the boy crying?’

original: zhes dris pa dang / des smras pa /
analyzed: zhes dris pa dang / des smras pa /
translated: She said,

original: che zhe ci'i phyir du ba ma 'tshal to /
analyzed: che zhe ci'i phyir du ba ma 'tshal to /
translated: ‘Sister, I don’t know why.’

original: des de blangs te dga' ba bya bar brtsams te /
analyzed: des de blangs te dga' ba bya bar brtsams te /
translated: “She took him and began to play with him.

original: lag pas 'khyud de 'o byas nas pang par blangs kyang mi btub nas /
analyzed: lag pas 'khyud de 'o byas nas pang par blangs kyang mi btub nas /
translated: She embraced him, kissed him, and took him onto her lap, but he would not stay.

original: des de la nu ma blung nas ji tsam bltas pa dang / smyug ma'i thur ma zhig khar btsugs par mthong nas /
analyzed: des de la nu ma blung nas ji tsam bltas pa dang / smyug ma'i thur ma zhig khar btsugs par mthong nas /
translated: She let him suck her breast and looked at him. She saw a bamboo sliver in his mouth.

original: des myur du kha phye ste lag pas drangs pa dang / khye'u de dbugs med de dus las 'das nas /
analyzed: des myur du kha phye ste lag pas drangs pa dang / khye'u de dbugs med de dus las 'das nas /
translated: She quickly opened his mouth and pulled it out with her finger. The boy lost consciousness and died.

original: brang brdungs te ngu zhing sa la 'gyel ba dang / khyim gyi skye po rnams brgyugs nas /
analyzed: brang brdungs te ngu zhing sa la 'gyel ba dang / khyim gyi skye po rnams brgyugs nas /
translated: The people of the house rushed to her and asked,🔽“What is the matter?”

original: 'di ci nyes zhes dris pa dang / des snying rje zhing brtse bas mchi mas brnangs bzhin du smras pa /
analyzed: 'di ci nyes zhes dris pa dang / des snying rje zhing brtse bas mchi mas brnangs bzhin du smras pa /
translated: She said to them with compassion and love, her voice choked with tears,

original: kye ma ma @201b yar mo sdig pa'i chos spyod pa 'di phrag dog gis khros nas /
analyzed: kye ma ma @201b yar mo sdig pa'i chos spyod pa 'di phrag dog gis khros nas /
translated: “Alas! This wicked woman, who practices evil, was angry with jealousy.

original: bdag gi bu'i khar smyug ma'i thur ma btsugs te bsad do //
analyzed: bdag gi bu'i khar smyug ma'i thur ma btsugs te bsad do //
translated: She stuck a bamboo splinter into my son’s mouth and killed him!”

original: de dag ngu bar gyur nas /
analyzed: de dag ngu bar gyur nas /
translated: They all began to weep.

original: 'khor gyi khyim mtshes dag gis thos nas /
analyzed: 'khor gyi khyim mtshes dag gis thos nas /
translated: The neighbors heard them.

original: de dag gis kyang brgyugs te smras pa /
analyzed: de dag gis kyang brgyugs te smras pa /
translated: They rushed to the house and said,

original: ae ma'o 'di ni glo bur zhig byas te /
analyzed: ae ma'o 'di ni glo bur zhig byas te /
translated: “Alas! This is a sudden misfortune!

original: byis pa 'di nyes pa med cing gnod pa med par bsad do //
analyzed: byis pa 'di nyes pa med cing gnod pa med par bsad do //
translated: This child was innocent and did no wrong. He was killed!”

original: zhes zer pa nas /
analyzed: zhes zer pa nas /
translated: And so on.

original: des de la skye bo mang po dag gis ae ma'o zhes zer zhing kun tu bskor to //
analyzed: des de la skye bo mang po dag gis ae ma'o zhes zer zhing kun tu bskor to //
translated: The people all said, “Alas!” and surrounded her.

original: de ni brang brdung zhing ngu ste /
analyzed: de ni brang brdung zhing ngu ste /
translated: She beat her breast and wept.

original: mna' 'dor ba de ste /
analyzed: mna' 'dor ba de ste /
translated: She swore an oath,

original: bdag gis khyod kyi bu gsad par gyur na /
analyzed: bdag gis khyod kyi bu gsad par gyur na /
translated: “If I killed your son,

original: bdag gi khyo yang sprul gyis zos te /
analyzed: bdag gi khyo yang sprul gyis zos te /
translated: May my husband be eaten by a snake

original: dus byed par shog cig /
analyzed: dus byed par shog cig /
translated: and die!

original: bu gcig ni was zos par shog cig /
analyzed: bu gcig ni was zos par shog cig /
translated: May one of my sons be eaten by a wolf!

original: gnyis pa chu bor lhungs te dus byed par shog cig /
analyzed: gnyis pa chu bor lhungs te dus byed par shog cig /
translated: May the other fall into the river and die!

original: pha ma gnam lcags kyis gsod par shog cig /
analyzed: pha ma gnam lcags kyis gsod par shog cig /
translated: May my parents be killed by lightning!

original: bu'i sha yang zos la smyo zhing phyar ba'i sems kyis phan tshun 'khyam par shog cig /
analyzed: bu'i sha yang zos la smyo zhing phyar ba'i sems kyis phan tshun 'khyam par shog cig /
translated: May I eat my son’s flesh, and with a mind that is crazy and agitated, may I wander around here and there!”

original: ces mna' dor ro //
analyzed: ces mna' dor ro //
translated: She swore this oath.

original: dge slong dag ji snyam du sems /
analyzed: dge slong dag ji snyam du sems /
translated: “Bhikṣus, what do you think?

original: khyim bdag de'i chung ma gnyis pa ni 'di ltar 'di bzhin dge slong ma skem mo go'u ta mi 'di'o //
analyzed: khyim bdag de'i chung ma gnyis pa ni 'di ltar 'di bzhin dge slong ma skem mo go'u ta mi 'di'o //
translated: The second wife of that householder then is this bhikṣuṇī, the Gotami Kātyāyanī.

original: 'di shin tu nyon mongs pas kun tu khebs pas na /
analyzed: 'di shin tu nyon mongs pas kun tu khebs pas na /
translated: Because she was completely covered by a great deal of affliction,🔽when she killed the boy, she lied and swore an oath.

original: khye'u bsad na yang rdzun du smra zhing mna' bor ba de'i las kyi rnam par smin pas /
analyzed: khye'u bsad na yang rdzun du smra zhing mna' bor ba de'i las kyi rnam par smin pas /
translated: The ripening of that karma

original: 'di'i khyo sprul gyis zos te /
analyzed: 'di'i khyo sprul gyis zos te /
translated: was that her husband was eaten by a snake

original: dus las 'das so //🔽bu gcig ni was bsad do //
analyzed: dus las 'das so // bu gcig ni was bsad do //
translated: and died.🔽One of her sons was killed by a wolf.

original: gcig ni chu bor lhung ste dus las 'das so //
analyzed: gcig ni chu bor lhung ste dus las 'das so //
translated: The other fell into the river and died.

original: pha ma ni gnam lcags lhung bas shi'o //🔽bu sha zos te /
analyzed: pha ma ni gnam lcags lhung bas shi'o // bu sha zos te /
translated: His parents died when lightning struck them.

original: sgren mor smyos shing yan @202a *//
analyzed: sgren mor smyos shing yan @202a *//
translated: He ate his parents’ flesh,🔽and his mind was disturbed.

original: man du g-yeng pa'i sems kyis phan tshun du 'khyams so //
analyzed: man du g-yeng pa'i sems kyis phan tshun du 'khyams so //
translated: He wandered around naked,

original: gzhan yang bcom ldan 'das 'od srung las rab tu byung bar gyur te /
analyzed: gzhan yang bcom ldan 'das 'od srung las rab tu byung bar gyur te /
translated: and he went forth under the Blessed One Kāśyapa.

original: der 'dis tshe gcig tu tshangs par spyad pa spyod kyang yon tan gyi chos mang po gang yang ma chud do //
analyzed: der 'dis tshe gcig tu tshangs par spyad pa spyod kyang yon tan gyi chos mang po gang yang ma chud do //
translated: Although he practiced pure conduct all his life, he did not acquire any of the many excellent qualities.

original: gang la rab tu byung ba'i mkhan mo de /
analyzed: gang la rab tu byung ba'i mkhan mo de /
translated: The preceptor under whom he went forth

original: bcom ldan 'das 'od srung yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyis 'dul ba 'dzin pa rnams kyi nang na mchog tu gsungs so //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das 'od srung yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyis 'dul ba 'dzin pa rnams kyi nang na mchog tu gsungs so //
translated: was declared by the Blessed One, the perfect Buddha Kāśyapa, to be foremost among those who uphold the vinaya.

original: de na 'di 'chi ba'i tshe smon lam btab pa /
analyzed: de na 'di 'chi ba'i tshe smon lam btab pa /
translated: At the time of his death, he prayed,

original: gang bdag gis bcom ldan 'das 'od srung bla na med pa yon gnas kyi drung du tshe gcig tu tshangs par spyod pa spyad kyang yon tan mang po gcig kyang ma chud de /
analyzed: gang bdag gis bcom ldan 'das 'od srung bla na med pa yon gnas kyi drung du tshe gcig tu tshangs par spyod pa spyad kyang yon tan mang po gcig kyang ma chud de /
translated: “Although I practiced pure conduct all my life in the presence of the Blessed One Kāśyapa, who is worthy of offerings, I did not acquire any of the many excellent qualities.

original: bdag dge ba'i rtsa ba 'dis gang bcom ldan 'das 'od srung yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyis bram ze'i khye'u bla ma la bram ze'i khye'u khyod skye dgu'i tshe lo brgya thub pa na /
analyzed: bdag dge ba'i rtsa ba 'dis gang bcom ldan 'das 'od srung yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyis bram ze'i khye'u bla ma la bram ze'i khye'u khyod skye dgu'i tshe lo brgya thub pa na /
translated: “Blessed One, by this root of virtue, may I become a buddha just like the Blessed One, the thus-gone, the worthy one, the perfect buddha Kāśyapa.”🔽

original: sh'akya thub pa de bzhin gshegs pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas su 'gyur ro zhes lung bstan pa de'i bstan pa la bdag rab tu 'byung nas /
analyzed: sh'akya thub pa de bzhin gshegs pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas su 'gyur ro zhes lung bstan pa de'i bstan pa la bdag rab tu 'byung nas /
translated: “Blessed One, by this root of virtue, may I go forth in the doctrine of the Blessed One, the thus-gone, the worthy one, the perfect Buddha Kāśyapa, who has prophesied that the young brahmin Uttara will become the thus-gone, the worthy one, the perfect Buddha Śākyamuni when the lifespan of beings is one hundred years.

original: nyon mongs pa thams cad spangs te /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa thams cad spangs te /
translated: May I then abandon all afflictive emotions

original: dgra bcom pa mngon du byas nas /🔽ji ltar bdag gis mkhan mo 'di la /
analyzed: dgra bcom pa mngon du byas nas / ji ltar bdag gis mkhan mo 'di la /
translated: and actualize arhatship.

original: bcom ldan 'das 'od srung yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyis 'dul ba 'dzin pa'i nang na mchog tu gsungs pa de bzhin du bdag kyang bcom ldan 'das sh'akya'i rgyal po des 'dul ba 'dzin pa nang na mchog tu @202b gsungs par shog cig /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das 'od srung yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyis 'dul ba 'dzin pa'i nang na mchog tu gsungs pa de bzhin du bdag kyang bcom ldan 'das sh'akya'i rgyal po des 'dul ba 'dzin pa nang na mchog tu @202b gsungs par shog cig /
translated: Just as my preceptor has been declared by the Blessed One, the thus-gone, the worthy one, the perfect Buddha Kāśyapa to be supreme among those who uphold the vinaya, may I too be declared by the Blessed One, the king of the Śākyas, to be supreme among those who uphold the vinaya.”

original: 'dis de na tshe gcig tu tshangs par spyod pa spyad pas na /
analyzed: 'dis de na tshe gcig tu tshangs par spyod pa spyad pas na /
translated: He practiced pure conduct all his life.

original: de nga'i bstan pa la rab tu byung zhing nyon mongs pa thams cad spangs nas dgra bcom pa mngon du byas so //
analyzed: de nga'i bstan pa la rab tu byung zhing nyon mongs pa thams cad spangs nas dgra bcom pa mngon du byas so //
translated: He went forth in my very doctrine, cast away all afflictive emotions, and manifested arhatship.

original: gang 'dul ba 'dzin pa'i nang nas mchog tu shog cig ces smon lam btab ste /
analyzed: gang 'dul ba 'dzin pa'i nang nas mchog tu shog cig ces smon lam btab ste /
translated: He prayed, ‘May I be foremost among those who uphold the vinaya.’

original: smon lam de'i mthus da ltar de bzhin gshegs pas 'dul ba 'dzin pa'i nang na mchog tu gsungs so //
analyzed: smon lam de'i mthus da ltar de bzhin gshegs pas 'dul ba 'dzin pa'i nang na mchog tu gsungs so //
translated: By the power of that prayer, the Thus-Gone One has now declared him to be foremost among those who uphold the vinaya.”

original: gzhan yang dge slong dag gis bcom ldan 'das la zhus pa /
analyzed: gzhan yang dge slong dag gis bcom ldan 'das la zhus pa /
translated: The monks asked the Blessed One,

original: btsun pa skem mo go'u ta mi'i pha ma gnyis kyis las ci zhig bgyis na las gang gis rnam par smin pas /🔽gnam lcags lhung ste gum par gyur /
analyzed: btsun pa skem mo go'u ta mi'i pha ma gnyis kyis las ci zhig bgyis na las gang gis rnam par smin pas / gnam lcags lhung ste gum par gyur /
translated: “Lord, what action did the parents of the gaunt Gautama take that ripened into their deaths by lightning?

original: khyos las ci zhig bgyis na sprul gyis 'tshal nas dus las 'das /
analyzed: khyos las ci zhig bgyis na sprul gyis 'tshal nas dus las 'das /
translated: What action did the husband take that ripened into his death by snakebite?

original: bu gnyis kyis las ci zhig bgyis na gcig ni was 'tshal /
analyzed: bu gnyis kyis las ci zhig bgyis na gcig ni was 'tshal /
translated: What action did the two sons take that ripened into the death of one by a wolf

original: gcig ni chu bor lhung ste dus las 'das par gyur /
analyzed: gcig ni chu bor lhung ste dus las 'das par gyur /
translated: and the death of the other by drowning?”🔽“Monks, the gaunt Gautama’s parents took birth as a pair of nāga kings.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: dge slong dag de dag nyid kyis las byas shing bsags pas tshogs rnyed cing rkyen smin pa na /
analyzed: dge slong dag de dag nyid kyis las byas shing bsags pas tshogs rnyed cing rkyen smin pa na /
translated: “Monks, they themselves have performed and accumulated these actions, gathering the causes and conditions.

original: chu bo bzhin du nye bar gnas pa ni gdon mi za bar 'gyur ro; ;de dag gis las byas shing bsags pa ni /
analyzed: chu bo bzhin du nye bar gnas pa ni gdon mi za bar 'gyur ro; ;de dag gis las byas shing bsags pa ni /
translated: Since they are present, they will certainly experience the results.

original: gzhan sus kyang myong bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan sus kyang myong bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: No one else will experience the actions they themselves have performed and accumulated.

original: dge slong rnams las byas shing bsags pa ni /🔽phyi rol gyi sa'i khams la rnam par mi smin /
analyzed: dge slong rnams las byas shing bsags pa ni / phyi rol gyi sa'i khams la rnam par mi smin /
translated: Monks, actions that have been performed and accumulated

original: chu'i khams la ma yin /🔽me'i khams la ma yin /
analyzed: chu'i khams la ma yin / me'i khams la ma yin /
translated: do not ripen in the external elements of earth, water, fire,

original: rlung gi khams la ma yin gyi /
analyzed: rlung gi khams la ma yin gyi /
translated: or wind.🔽Rather, they ripen in the very aggregates, elements, and sense bases that have been appropriated.

original: zin pa'i phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched 'di nyid la dge ba dang / mi dge ba'i las byas pa rnam par @203a *//🔽smin to // las rnams stor bar mi 'gyur pa //
analyzed: zin pa'i phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched 'di nyid la dge ba dang / mi dge ba'i las byas pa rnam par @203a *// smin to // las rnams stor bar mi 'gyur pa //
translated: The results of virtuous and nonvirtuous actions ripen in the aggregates, elements, and sense bases.

original: bskal pa dag ni brgya lon kyang //
analyzed: bskal pa dag ni brgya lon kyang //
translated: Actions are never lost, even after a hundred aeons.

original: dus dang 'phrod na 'thob pa ni /
analyzed: dus dang 'phrod na 'thob pa ni /
translated: When the time and the conditions are right,

original: lus can rnams la 'bras bur smin /
analyzed: lus can rnams la 'bras bur smin /
translated: they will be experienced by embodied beings.

original: dge slong dag sngon byung ba na bskal pa bzang po 'dir skye bo tshe lo nyi khri thub pa na 'od srung zhes bya ba'i ston pa 'jig rten du byung ste /
analyzed: dge slong dag sngon byung ba na bskal pa bzang po 'dir skye bo tshe lo nyi khri thub pa na 'od srung zhes bya ba'i ston pa 'jig rten du byung ste /
translated: “Monks, in the past, in this fortunate eon, when people lived as long as twenty thousand years and the teacher known as Kāśyapa was present in the world,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rig pa dang / rkang par ldan pa /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rig pa dang / rkang par ldan pa /
translated: there appeared in the world a thus-gone one, a worthy one, a perfect buddha, someone with perfect knowledge and conduct,

original: bde bar gshegs pa /
analyzed: bde bar gshegs pa /
translated: a blissful one,

original: 'jig rten mkhyen pa /
analyzed: 'jig rten mkhyen pa /
translated: a knower of the world,

original: bla na med pa /
analyzed: bla na med pa /
translated: an unsurpassed being,

original: skyes bu 'dul ba'i kha lo sgyur ba lha dang mi rnams kyi ston pa sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das yul 'khor mo 'jig gi grong khyer gyi drang srong bzhin gyi ri dvags gnas na bzhugs so //
analyzed: skyes bu 'dul ba'i kha lo sgyur ba lha dang mi rnams kyi ston pa sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das yul 'khor mo 'jig gi grong khyer gyi drang srong bzhin gyi ri dvags gnas na bzhugs so //
translated: a charioteer to be tamed, a teacher of gods and humans, a blessed buddha.

original: de'i dus na yul 'khor mo 'jig na khyim bdag gzhan zhig gnas te /🔽phyug pa / nor mang ba /
analyzed: de'i dus na yul 'khor mo 'jig na khyim bdag gzhan zhig gnas te / phyug pa / nor mang ba /
translated: “At that time, there lived in the city of Vārāṇasī a certain householder

original: longs spyod che ba /
analyzed: longs spyod che ba /
translated: who was rich and had great wealth.🔽He was very wealthy,

original: gnas yangs shing rgyas pa /🔽ngal bsos bu bzhin nor 'du ba /
analyzed: gnas yangs shing rgyas pa / ngal bsos bu bzhin nor 'du ba /
translated: with vast and extensive property,

original: ngal bsos po'i nor la sngo ba des /
analyzed: ngal bsos po'i nor la sngo ba des /
translated: and his wealth was like that of Vaiśravaṇa.

original: chu bo bar ka ya'i pha rol tu gtsug lag khang zhig brtsigs te /
analyzed: chu bo bar ka ya'i pha rol tu gtsug lag khang zhig brtsigs te /
translated: He built a temple on the other side of the river Vākṣu.

original: der yul so so na gnas pa'i dge slong dag gnas te /
analyzed: der yul so so na gnas pa'i dge slong dag gnas te /
translated: Monks from various countries lived there.

original: khyim bdag de las skye bo'i grong mi dag gis zong blangs shing 'dong ngo //
analyzed: khyim bdag de las skye bo'i grong mi dag gis zong blangs shing 'dong ngo //
translated: The people of the city took their goods from the householder and left.

original: de la gcig gis lan gsum gyi bar du zong chus gsan pa dang / des de la smras pa /
analyzed: de la gcig gis lan gsum gyi bar du zong chus gsan pa dang / des de la smras pa /
translated: One of them lost his goods three times in the water, and he said to him,

original: 'di ltar drin med pa khyod kyis brnogs te /
analyzed: 'di ltar drin med pa khyod kyis brnogs te /
translated: “You are so ungrateful.

original: bdag gi zong lan gsum du chud gsan gyi /
analyzed: bdag gi zong lan gsum du chud gsan gyi /
translated: You have caused me to lose my goods three times.

original: nor ma byin gyi bar du ma 'gro zhig /
analyzed: nor ma byin gyi bar du ma 'gro zhig /
translated: Don’t go until you give me my money.”

original: @203b des smras pa /
analyzed: @203b des smras pa /
translated: He said,

original: khyim bdag lan cig stsol la de chud gsan na /

translated: Even if one does not attain the bliss of unexcelled yoga and the transcendence of suffering, the wise one should aspire to go forth, seeing that one will be reborn as a god.🔽The wise one should aspire to go forth, seeing that going forth is praised by the Buddha, the Buddha’s disciples, the wise, the virtuous, and the holy.

original: ba'i mkhas pas rab tu 'byung ba la mos par bya ba'i rigs so //🔽rnam grangs du ma las kyang rab tu 'byung ba ni /
analyzed: ba'i mkhas pas rab tu 'byung ba la mos par bya ba'i rigs so // rnam grangs du ma las kyang rab tu 'byung ba ni /
translated: The wise one should aspire to go forth, seeing that going forth is praised in many ways.

original: sangs rgyas dang / sangs rgyas kyi nyan thos dang / mkhas pa dang yang dag par song ba dang / skyes bu dam pa dag gis bstod par mthong ba'i mkhas pas rab tu 'byung ba la mos par bya ba'i rigs so //
analyzed: sangs rgyas dang / sangs rgyas kyi nyan thos dang / mkhas pa dang yang dag par song ba dang / skyes bu dam pa dag gis bstod par mthong ba'i mkhas pas rab tu 'byung ba la mos par bya ba'i rigs so //
translated: The wise one should aspire to go forth, seeing that going forth is praised by the Buddha, the Buddha’s disciples, the wise, the virtuous, and the holy.

original: ci bdag gis tshe gzhan du 'dod pa'i phyir sdug bsngal myong ba de mnyan par 'dod dam /
analyzed: ci bdag gis tshe gzhan du 'dod pa'i phyir sdug bsngal myong ba de mnyan par 'dod dam /
translated: Do I want to hear about the suffering I will experience in other lives for the sake of sensual pleasures?

original: 'on te tshe 'di la myong ba rnams mnyan par 'dod /
analyzed: 'on te tshe 'di la myong ba rnams mnyan par 'dod /
translated: Or do you want to hear about the sufferings I experienced in this life?”

original: de dag gis 'phags ma khyod kyis /
analyzed: de dag gis 'phags ma khyod kyis /
translated: “Noble lady,

original: tshe gzhan du 'dod pa'i phyir sdug bsngal myong ba ni re zhig zhog la /
analyzed: tshe gzhan du 'dod pa'i phyir sdug bsngal myong ba ni re zhig zhog la /

original: gang tshe 'di nyid la myong ba rnams gsungs shig /
analyzed: gang tshe 'di nyid la myong ba rnams gsungs shig /
translated: Please tell us about the sufferings you experienced in this very life.”🔽She told them in detail about the sufferings of being separated from her father, mother, husband, and son, and about the suffering of eating her son’s flesh.

original: ces smras pa dang / des de dag la pha dang / ma dang / khyo dang / bu rnams las bral ba'i sdug bsngal dang / bu sha zos pa'i sdug bsngal ji ltar gyur pa zhib tu smras pa dang / de dag skyo nas pa spu kun gyi khung bu yang g-yos te /
analyzed: ces smras pa dang / des de dag la pha dang / ma dang / khyo dang / bu rnams las bral ba'i sdug bsngal dang / bu sha zos pa'i sdug bsngal ji ltar gyur pa zhib tu smras pa dang / de dag skyo nas pa spu kun gyi khung bu yang g-yos te /
translated: They were saddened and their body hairs quivered.

original: rna ba byo nas skem mo go'u ta mi'i gdong du bltas pa dang / des de dag gi bsam pa dang / bag la nyal ba dang / khams dang / rang bzhin rnams shes nas /
analyzed: rna ba byo nas skem mo go'u ta mi'i gdong du bltas pa dang / des de dag gi bsam pa dang / bag la nyal ba dang / khams dang / rang bzhin rnams shes nas /
translated: They listened with rapt attention, looking at Gautamī’s face. She knew their thoughts, habitual tendencies, temperaments, and natures,

original: 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi yang dag par rtogs par 'gyur ba de lta bu'i chos bshad do //
analyzed: 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi yang dag par rtogs par 'gyur ba de lta bu'i chos bshad do //
translated: and she taught them the Dharma so that they realized the four noble truths.

original: de thos nas de dag gis 'jig tshogs su lta ba'i ri'i rtse mo nyi shu gyen du byung ba /
analyzed: de thos nas de dag gis 'jig tshogs su lta ba'i ri'i rtse mo nyi shu gyen du byung ba /
translated: Having heard that, they knocked down the twenty peaks of the mountain of the false view of individuality.

original: ye shes kyi rdo rjes bcom ste /
analyzed: ye shes kyi rdo rjes bcom ste /
translated: When they heard this, they destroyed with the diamond-chip of knowledge the twenty high peaks of the mountain of views concerning the transitory collection.

original: rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu mngon du byas so //
analyzed: rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu mngon du byas so //
translated: They manifested the resultant state of stream entry.

original: de dag bden pa mthong ste /🔽'phags @206b ma bdag cag do zhig go /
analyzed: de dag bden pa mthong ste / 'phags @206b ma bdag cag do zhig go /
translated: They saw the truths.🔽“Noble one, we are drowning!”

original: bdag cag rab tu do zhig go /
analyzed: bdag cag rab tu do zhig go /
translated: “We are drowning!”

original: 'phags ma spom dga' mes bdag cag 'dod pa'i 'dam du do bcug go /
analyzed: 'phags ma spom dga' mes bdag cag 'dod pa'i 'dam du do bcug go /
translated: “Noble Utpalavarṇā, we are drowning in the mud of desire!”

original: zhes smras pa dang / skem mo go'u ta mis /
analyzed: zhes smras pa dang / skem mo go'u ta mis /
translated: The nun Gautamī asked,🔽“Sisters, what happened?”

original: nu mo dag ci byas zhes dris pa dang / de dag gis kyang zhib tu smras so //
analyzed: nu mo dag ci byas zhes dris pa dang / de dag gis kyang zhib tu smras so //
translated: They told her in detail.

original: des nu mo dag /
analyzed: des nu mo dag /
translated: She said,

original: 'di la ci zhig bya /
analyzed: 'di la ci zhig bya /
translated: “Sisters, what should we do?

original: de ni nyes pa sbom po spyod pa ste /
analyzed: de ni nyes pa sbom po spyod pa ste /
translated: She is a practitioner of serious faults.

original: des bcom ldan 'das kyi bstan pa chu 'gram gyi gad pa bzhin 'dor ro //🔽zhes smras pa dang / don nyung ba'i dge slong ma dag 'phya spong ste /
analyzed: des bcom ldan 'das kyi bstan pa chu 'gram gyi gad pa bzhin 'dor ro // zhes smras pa dang / don nyung ba'i dge slong ma dag 'phya spong ste /
translated: She is throwing out the Blessed One’s teaching like a dog throws up a bone.”🔽The nuns who had few desires criticized her,

original: kha ngan du zer ba na dge slong mas /
analyzed: kha ngan du zer ba na dge slong mas /
translated: “You are speaking harshly.”

original: dge slong ma dag slar khyim du bskrad pa ga la srid ces zer ro //
analyzed: dge slong ma dag slar khyim du bskrad pa ga la srid ces zer ro //
translated: “How could it be possible for nuns to be expelled from their homes?”

analyzed: de ltar gyur pa dge slong ma dag gis dge slong dag la smras so //

original: dge slong dag gis bcom ldan 'das la gsol nas /
analyzed: dge slong dag gis bcom ldan 'das la gsol nas /
translated: The monks reported it to the Blessed One.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

analyzed: de lta bas na dge slong mas dge slong ma khyim du 'jug par ma byed cig /
translated: “Therefore, nuns should not make nuns enter their homes.

original: 'jug par byed na nyes pa sbom por 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'jug par byed na nyes pa sbom por 'gyur ro //
translated: If they do, they become guilty of a serious offense.”

original: gleng gzhi ni mnyan du yod pa na ste /
analyzed: gleng gzhi ni mnyan du yod pa na ste /
translated: The Setting was in Śrāvastī.

original: dge slong ma gzhan zhig gis dge slong la spyod pa dang / dge slong de skrag par gyur te /
analyzed: dge slong ma gzhan zhig gis dge slong la spyod pa dang / dge slong de skrag par gyur te /

analyzed: de ltar gyur pa dge slong dag gis bcom ldan 'das la gsol to //
translated: The monks reported this matter to the Blessed One.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

analyzed: de lta bas na dge slong mas dge slong la spyo bar ma byed cig /
translated: “Therefore, nuns should not scold monks.

original: spyo bar byed na 'das pa dang bcas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: spyo bar byed na 'das pa dang bcas par 'gyur ro //
translated: If they do, they become guilty of an offense entailing confession.”

analyzed: dge tshul mas dge slong dang / dge slong ma dang / dge slong ma dang dge tshul pha dang / dge tshul ma la yang mi bya'o //
translated: A novice monk should not do it to a monk, a nun, a trainee nun, a novice monk, or a novice nun.🔽The summary:

original: sdom ni / mdun du 'gro bar mi bya ste //
analyzed: sdom ni / mdun du 'gro bar mi bya ste //
translated: Do not walk in front of a nun;

original: ldang par bya'o dge slong ma /
analyzed: ldang par bya'o dge slong ma /
translated: a nun should stand up for a monk.🔽After asking permission, she should sit;

analyzed: zhus nas 'dug par bya ba dang // skyil mo krung dang rnam grangs med //

analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das mnyan du yod pa dze ta'i tshal mgon med zas sbyin gyi kun dga' ra ba na bzhugs so //

analyzed: de'i tshe tshe dang ldan pa 'od srung chen po mnyan du yod pa'i sngon gyi skyed mos tshal ri dvags sgra'i khang pa na 'dug go / de nas tshe dang ldan pa 'od srung chen po snga dro sham thabs dang chos gos gyon /
translated: At that time, the venerable Mahākāśyapa was staying in the Deer Park at Ṛṣivadana near the city of Vārāṇasī.

original: lhung bzed khyer te /
analyzed: lhung bzed khyer te /
translated: Then, in the morning, the venerable Mahākāśyapa put on his robes and took his bowl,

analyzed: mnyan du yod par bsod snyoms kyi phyir zhugs so //
translated: and entered Vārāṇasī for alms.🔽The nun Chanda also, in the morning, put on her robes and took her bowl, and entered Vārāṇasī for alms.

analyzed: dge slong ma sbom dga' mo yang snga dro sham thabs dang / chos gos gyon lhung bzed khyer nas mnyan du yod par bsod snyoms la zhugs pa dang / des tshe dang ldan pa 'od srung mthong nas /
translated: When she saw the venerable Mahākāśyapa,

analyzed: glen pa 'di la mi dga' bar bya'o snyam bsams nas /

analyzed: khyim gang du tshe dang ldan pa 'od srung chen po 'gro ba der mo thog mar song ste /
translated: So she went first to the house where the venerable Mahākāśyapa was going,🔽and sat down inside the door.

analyzed: sgo'i nang logs su 'dug nas 'phags pa da ltar ni sbyar ba cung zad kyang med kyi /
translated: “Noble one, there is nothing to offer right now.

analyzed: song zhig / ces smras pa dang / de khyim gzhan du song ngo //

analyzed: der yang mo sngar song ste snga ma bzhin du gtses so //
translated: There, too, she was attacked as before.

analyzed: 'di bzhin du yang @207b gcig nas gcig tu byas pa dang / ma dgongs par ni dgra bcom pa'i ye shes kyi gzigs pa mi 'jug ste /
translated: “This is how it is,” she thought, “and I have no one to turn to.”🔽“Who is harming me?”

analyzed: su zhig bdag la 'tshe snyam dgongs na spom dga' mo yin par gzigs nas / des smras pa /
translated: “It is your sister,” she replied.

original: sring mo khyod kyis ma nyes kyi /
analyzed: sring mo khyod kyis ma nyes kyi /
translated: “Sister, it is not your fault.

original: tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bos nyes te /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bos nyes te /
translated: It is the fault of the venerable Ānanda.

original: nyes pa sbom po spyod pa'i bud med dag legs par bshad pa'i chos 'dul ba la rab tu byung zhing bsnyen par rdzogs nas; dge slong ma'i dngos por gnang bar byas pas nyes so //
analyzed: nyes pa sbom po spyod pa'i bud med dag legs par bshad pa'i chos 'dul ba la rab tu byung zhing bsnyen par rdzogs nas; dge slong ma'i dngos por gnang bar byas pas nyes so //
translated: It is his fault that he allowed women who have committed a heinous crime to go forth, to become fully ordained, and to enter the monastic life in the well-proclaimed Dharma and Vinaya.

original: de ltar gyur pa dge slong dag gis thos nas /
analyzed: de ltar gyur pa dge slong dag gis thos nas /
translated: ” When the monks heard what had happened,

analyzed: bcom ldan 'das la gsol ba dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis dgongs pa /
translated: they asked the Blessed One about it, and the Blessed One thought,

analyzed: gang cung zad dge slong mas /
translated: “Whatever it is, the nuns

analyzed: dge slong pha spyod yul du 'gro ba'i mdun du song na nyes pa'i dmigs su 'gyur te /
translated: If a nun goes in front of a monk on his alms round, she will be an object of criticism.

analyzed: de lta bas na dge slong mas dge slong gi spyod yul du bsod snyoms mi bslang bar dgongs nas /
translated: Therefore, thinking that a nun should not beg for alms in the monk’s domain,

analyzed: bka' stsal pa /
translated: the Blessed One said,

analyzed: dge slong dag /
translated: “Monks,

analyzed: dge slong 'od srung gis dge slong ma la rigs par spyos so //
translated: Kāśyapa the Great has reprimanded the nun properly.

translated: Therefore, a nun should not beg for alms in the monk’s domain. If a nun begs for alms in the monk’s domain, she will be guilty of an offense.

analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis dge slong mas dge slong gi spyod yul du bsod snyoms ma bslang zhig /
translated: ” The Blessed One said, “A nun should not beg for alms in the monk’s domain.

analyzed: ces gsungs pa dang / dge slong mas dge slong gi spyod yul spangs pa dang / de dag bsod snyoms kyis phongs par gyur nas /
translated: ” When the nuns gave up the monk’s domain, they were deprived of alms.

analyzed: de ltar gyur pa dge slong ma rnams kyis dge @208a *//
translated: The nuns told the monks,

analyzed: slong rnams la smras pa dang / dge slong rnams kyis bcom ldan 'das la gsol to //

analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis de lta bas na / dge slong mas dge slong spyod yul du 'dod ba'i mdun du 'gro bar mi bya'o //
translated: The Blessed One said, “Therefore,🔽monks, nuns should not walk in front of monks who are in their own district.

analyzed: gang spyod yul dge slong dag gis spangs par dge slong ma de dag dong bar byos shig /

analyzed: ces bka' stsal to //
translated: ”🔽The Setting was in Śrāvastī.

translated: Pramudita was sitting in front of a retinue of many hundreds of thousands, teaching the Dharma.

analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa 'od srung chen po lam der song ba dang / 'khor de dag gis tshe dang ldan pa 'od srung chen po mthong nas langs so //
translated: The venerable Mahākāśyapa was walking on that road, and when the retinue saw him, they stood up.🔽Pramudita did not move her buttocks,

analyzed: sbom dga' mo ni rkub ma bskyod pa dang / de dag gis /
translated: and they said,🔽“Venerable Pramudita, the venerable Mahākāśyapa is coming.

translated: he said, “It is not good that we stand while you do not rise from your seat.”

analyzed: zhes smras pa dang / des 'di ni mu stegs can las rab tu byung ba ste /

analyzed: blun pa / rab tu blun pa /
translated: He is stupid, very stupid,🔽a fool, a great fool.

original: glen pa / rab tu glen pas na bdag sh'akya mo las rab tu byung ba /
analyzed: glen pa / rab tu glen pas na bdag sh'akya mo las rab tu byung ba /
translated: Since I went forth from among the Śākyas,

analyzed: sde snod gsum pa chos kyi gtam can /
translated: I am a tripiṭaka master who can speak on the Dharma.🔽Since I am eloquent and liberated, why should I rise when I see him?”

analyzed: rig pa dang grol ba la spobs pas ci'i phyir 'di mthong ba dang stan las ldang / zhes smras pa dang / dge slong dag gis de thos te / bcom ldan 'das la gsol nas /
translated: The monks heard this🔽and reported it to the Blessed One.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

analyzed: dge slong dag dad pa'i bram ze dang / khyim bdag rnams ni rigs par 'phya'o //
translated: “Monks, faithful brahmins and householders despise the wise.

analyzed: de lta bas na dge slong mas @208b dge slong mthong ma thag tu stan las longs shig /

analyzed: ma langs na 'das pa dang bcas par 'gyur ro //
translated: If she does not rise, she will be guilty of an offense.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa /
translated: The Blessed One said:
